instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.ALLSYS_PWRGD: What is ALLSYS_PWRGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALLSYS_PWRGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
I have another macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that is consuming 520 ma, it does not have USB activity, it does not have thunderbolt activity. I have all the rails present (from the schematic page 68)... this is the second board that I have with this problem, please help me figure it out. 
The board is in S0 state, has cpu vcore, <SIGNAL>ALLSYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
What else can I check? Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
Any history available?
Check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
You can also try to flash new BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
Any history available? Left it on and the next morning won´t turn on...
Check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
SPI Bus Series Termination resistors = all with the correct values...
Where can I find the BIOS? Can you send me a Link for that?
Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
Link should be already posted in other thread...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Hhdhd_t-9FxALozsa2067WnfRAUZqxNr/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message: And if that doesn´t work? What should I do?? Any sugestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
Maybe bad CPU.
Try BIOS first...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message: I tried the BIOS, it didn´t worked... I refuse to think its a dead cpu, it was one the night  before and working just fine... there must be something we´re missing....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A .520A not turning on
threads.message:
Could be, this is not an exact science...

Did you get any activity on the SPI chip with o-scope?
